nodes.documentation: @dev the constructor
nodes.name: TokenSale

nodes.documentation:
@dev The fallback function is called when ether is sent to the contract, it
 simply calls `doPayment()` with the address that sent the ether as the
 `_owner`. Payable is a required solidity modifier for functions to receive
 ether, without this modifier functions will throw if ether is sent to them

@notice `proxyPayment()` allows the caller to send ether to the TokenSale and
 have the tokens created in an address of their choosing
nodes.name: proxyPayment

nodes.documentation:
@notice Notifies the controller about a transfer, for this TokenSale all
 transfers are allowed by default and no extra notifications are needed
nodes.name: onTransfer

params._newController: The new controller of the contract

changeTokenController(address).details: Allow the owner of TokenSale to change the controller of the token

finalizeSale().details: `finalizeSale()` can only be called after the end of the funding period or if the maximum amount is raised.

handleEarlySaleBuyers(address[],uint256[.details: utility function to allow the owner to handle the early sale purchases

handleExternalBuyers(address[],uint256[].details: utility function to allow the owner to handle private and bitcoin buyers

updateDates(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint.details: update method for all the dates

changeController(address).notice: Changes the controller of the contract

finalizeSale().notice: `finalizeSale()` ends the TokenSale. It will generate the platform and team tokens  and set the controller to the referral fee contract.

onApprove(address,address,uint256).notice: Notifies the controller about an approval, for this TokenSale all approvals are allowed by default and no extra notifications are needed

onTransfer(address,address,uint256).notice: Notifies the controller about a transfer, for this TokenSale all transfers are allowed by default and no extra notifications are needed

pauseContribution().notice: Pauses the contribution if there is any issue

proxyPayment(address).notice: `proxyPayment()` allows the caller to send ether to the TokenSale and have the tokens created in an address of their choosing
